class_notes:
(Same as SPAN 336-1 and ITAL 336-2)


This course introduces students to translation studies and the hands-on practice of translation. The process of translation is a re-creation that requires intercultural as well as interlingual expertise. To this end, we will engage in identifying and translating genre and register; intralingual translation; comparing source texts to multiple translated texts; inverse translation; group translations and workshops; and editing, revising, reflection, analysis and commentary on their own translations. Classes meet once a week in English (together with students from ITAL and CHN) and once a week in language-specific workshops.
PREREQUISITE: One course at the 300 level or explicit permission from the professor.

course_description: This course introduces translation theory and hands-on practice in multiple contexts. It is theoretical, methodological, creative. Students engage in multiple forms of translation (inverse, intra and inter-lingual) and meet regularly both as a whole class and in individual language-specific groups.
